Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, yes.  I remember it well...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: That's my boy!  Good swingin', kiddo.  Hey -- Michael... where's your brother?

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: He's inside.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Is he in his room?

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: Of course he's in his room.  All his "friends" are in there.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Shoom boom boo ba!  Shoom boom boo ba --

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Andy!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Andy, this has to stop.  Our house isn't a television station.  There is not a camera in that wall.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But I've got a sports show. Championship wrestling, at five.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You know that's not what I meant! Look, I'm gonna put my foot down! No more playing alone.  You wanna perform, you GOTTA have an audience!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: B-but I have them.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No!  That is NOT an audience!  That is PLASTER!  An audience is people made of flesh!  They -- live and breathe!  Got it?!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "Oh, the cow goes........."

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Moo.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "And the dog goes......"

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: WOOF!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "And the cat says......"

Speaker: drunk audience
Dialogue: MEOW!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "And the bird says..."

Speaker: drunk audience
Dialogue: TWEET!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "And the lion goes..."

Speaker: drunk audience
Dialogue: ROAR!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: "And that's the way it goes!"  Thank you.  Goodbye!

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: The comedy stylings of Andy Kaufman, Ladies and Gentlemen!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So, Mr. Besserman, same slot tomorrow...?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Eh, I dunno... Andy.  I'm... thinkin' of letting you go...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You're firing me??  You don't even pay me!

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Look -- I don't wanna seem insulting.  But... your act is like amateur hour: Singalongs... puppets... playing records...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What do you want?  "Take my wife, please"??

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Sure!  Comedy!  Make jokes about the traffic.  Do impressions.  Maybe a little blue material...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I don't swear.  I -- I don't do what everyone else does!

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Well, everyone else gets this place cookin'!  Pal, it's hard for me to move the booze when you're singin' "Pop Goes The Weasel."

Speaker: wiseass comic
Dialogue: So I'm getting my mother-in-law a special Christmas present: A pre- paid funeral!  The mortician asked me if I wanted her buried, embalmed or cremated.  I said, "Make it all three!  I'm not takin' any chances!"  Thank you.  Good night! The comic waves and exits.  APPLAUSE.  George politely claps.  A PIANO PLAYER jumps in with an upbeat show tune.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Pst.  What's the story with this guy?

Speaker: budd
Dialogue: I think he's Lithuanian.  None of us can understand him.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: He does a hell of an Elvis.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Hey, I really enjoyed your set.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: So I understand you're from Lithuania?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Caspiar?  I haven't heard of that.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Mr. Shapiro, it's an honor!!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Caspiar, huh?!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You see, I want to be the biggest star in the world.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: People love... comedians.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm not a comedian.  I have no talent.  I'm a song-and-dance man.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I've always wanted to play Carnegie Hall.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah, ha-ha.  That's funny.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: See, I don't want easy laughs.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You're insane.  But -- you might also be brilliant. Alright, Andy... let's do it.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Sammy, opening for David Brenner is a fine gig.  You'll be on the road... get some exposure...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Oh.  Hello?  George Shapiro here.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Er, yes.  Speaking.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Can I help you with something?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Beer.  Gear.  Deer.  Ear.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Look... I don't know what your problem is...

Speaker: little wendy
Dialogue: Now, while continuing your deep breathing, slowly open your eyes. You should feel rested, relaxed, and alert.

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: Do any thoughts come...?

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: Good...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I want to thank you, your Holiness. My heart is radiating with pure energy.

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: You always had a good heart.  But I'm proud of the progress you've made in your discipline. ANDY Yes.  TM got me focused.  In fact, my manager got me a TV gig!  It's just some new show with no budget, but I'm still excited.

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: Are you at peace with your family?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Um, yes.  I haven't fought with them, since I started here.

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: Goals are important.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I stopped drinking.  I gave up drugs.  And I'm meditating three hours a day.  It's the center of my life...

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: We are all impressed.

Speaker: little wendy
Dialogue: Okay.  Anyone else --?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh, wait!  I have a question.  Is there... is there a secret to being funny?

Speaker: yogi
Dialogue: Yes.  Silence.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: I still can't believe my brother's gonna be on TV...!

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: I hope he doesn't get nervous. STANLEY What's the difference?  This thing's on in the middle of the night -- no one's even gonna see it.

Speaker: host
Dialogue: Welcome back to Saturday Night Live! And now, as a special treat on our first show... musical guest ANDY KAUFMAN!!!

Speaker: lorne michaels
Dialogue: What's happening to him?

Speaker: lorne michaels
Dialogue: Oh my God, he's doing nothing.  It's dead air...!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Andy, c'mon IN!  Thanks for flyin' out here!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: The stewardess let me keep my headphones.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: That's... terrific!  But I got something better.  This is BIG...  You are getting a once-in-a- lifetime, unbelievably lucrative opportunity to star on... a PRIMETIME NETWORK SITCOM!!!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Sitcom...?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: And this is a CLASS ACT!  It's the guys who did the Mary Tyler Moore and Bob Newhart shows!  It takes place in a taxi stand!  And you're gonna be the Fonzie!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm -- Fonzie? GEORGE NO!  The Fonzie!  The crazy breakout character!  The guy that all the kids impersonate and put on their lunchboxes!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: George, I hate sitcoms.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: HANG ON, you ain't heard the best part!  ABC has seen your foreign man character, and they want to turn him into --  "Latka," a lovable, goofy mechanic!!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: "No"?  "No" to which part??

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No to the whole thing.  None of it sounds good.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Andy... this is every comedian's dream.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I told you, I'm not a comedian.  And sitcoms are the lowest form of entertainment: Stupid jokes and canned laughter.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: B-but, this is classy... they did Bob Newha--

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm not interested.  I want to create my own material.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You have to do it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I refuse.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: LISTEN, you arrogant putz!  I've been in this business for twenty years!  I know!  If you walk away from this opportunity, you will never, NEVER see another one like it again!!!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay.  Fine, I'll do it.  But I have a few terms.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Of course!  That's what negotiations are for.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Writing down my terms.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Are you makin' fun of me --?  This is RIDICULOUS!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Those are my terms.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: They're IMPOSSIBLE!!  Jesus!  I mean -- "two guaranteed guest shots for Tony Clifton"??!  Who is this TONY CLIFTON?!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: He's a Vegas entertainer.  I used to do impressions of him.  We sorta... got in a fight over that.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: This Clifton called me up.  He's a loon!  He HATES you! ANDY Nah, he just talks tough.  But I owe him one.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Mr. Kaufman will only appear in half the episodes.  Mr. Kaufman gets his own network Special.

Speaker: network guys
Dialogue: WHO???

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Tony Clifton.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Andy?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Eh, hi, Andy.  Look, this Tony Clifton... is he performing anywhere?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: That's alright.  Where...?

Speaker: angry guy
Dialogue: Goddamn, I paid five dollars for this.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Heh-heh.  How ya all doin'?

Speaker: angry guy
Dialogue: Fuck you!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: "Volare! Whoa, whoa. Cantare, Whoa whoa whoa whoa."

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Leave me alone.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Okay!  So, you havin' a good time, sir?!

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: Sure...

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: Bob.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Bob what?

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: Bob Gorsky.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: "Gorsky"?  What is that, Polish?

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Are you tryin' to do some of that Polack humor?  Well if that's so, you can just get the hell out of this restaurant!

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: It's my name.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: SHUT UP!  I hate them Polish jokes!

Speaker: sad sack
Dialogue: A -- a tourist.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: See, that's EXACTLY what I'm talkin' about!  Here!  I'LL give you a little humor!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: And YOU.  I wanna see you backstage!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Alright, I'm here.  What do you want?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Are you hungry?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I... I-I don't understand this act. ANDY  It's good old-fashioned entertainment.  Everyone loves a villain.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah?  Well tell that to the poor schlub who you humiliated!

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Hey Andy, good show.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh George, this is Bob Zmuda.  Bob and I have been buddies for years.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: That was a really hot house!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: So your name's not Gorsky.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Don't believe everything you hear.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: This has to stay in the room... but here's the thing: Andy is Tony.  And Tony is Andy!  They'll deny it up and down, but I swear to God, they're the same person!  It's smart business!  You'll get two Andy Kaufmans for the price of one!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What's up?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Andy... THEY SAID YES!  They agreed to it all!  They thought your terms were a shining example of your "irreverent wit" -- and precisely why they want you!  You're getting EVERYTHING!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well thank you very much...!

Speaker: tony danza
Dialogue: Man, this is bullshit!  Where's Kaufman?  Why isn't he here??

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: You'll see him on Friday when we shoot.  Now run the lines with Rodney.

Speaker: judd hirsch
Dialogue: I'm taking bets we do the show with the stand-in.

Speaker: marilu henner
Dialogue: No, I hear Andy arrived.  Rumor is he's locked inside his dressing room.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm gonna quit.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: What?!?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Each show is worse than the next.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Are you nuts?!  40 million people watch you every week!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: So?  What do they know?

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Absolutely nothing!  That's the beauty!  It's credibility.  You make them love you... and then later, on your special, you'll screw with their heads!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: I don't care!  Travolta signed a contract, he's a Sweathog for life!... Oh yeah?  Just try to sue us.

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Sir, they're having a problem down on the Kaufman Special.  They say he's not following the... technical requirements.

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: "Technical"???

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's my show!  Now make it roll!

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Andy, I hear fabulous things about the Special...  Eh, I understand we've hit a teeny speedbump?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: Yeah, Kid Genius told me to mess with the horizontal hold!  He wants the picture to roll!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Show me.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It'll be great.  The viewer will think their TV is broken.  They'll get out of their chair, they'll twist the knobs, they'll hit the TV, but they won't be able to fix it!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Andy... we don't want the viewer to get out of their chair.  They might change the channel.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But it's funny!  It's a practical joke.  They'll get frustrated!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Andy... uhh... this network has a long-standing policy: The viewer must be able to see the program.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But it's only for thirty seconds!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Five.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Twenty!

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Ten.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Deal.

Speaker: studio page
Dialogue: Mr. Kaufman, do you want your mail?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: ... Yes, it's Andy Kaufman!... Really! ...I got your fan letter... So you like the show?  Your letter said I was silly.  Did you think I was too silly?... Oh good.  I'm glad.

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: ... so after I finish junior college, I'll go to work for my dad's accounting firm.  Unless, I decide to live with my friend Valerie, but she wants to move to Anaheim, and I don't want to do that.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: Excuse me -- ?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Do you wanna wrestle?  It's a good way of breaking the ice.  That instant physical intimacy really brings two people together.

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: What are you talking about?!  We just met an hour ago.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No no no, it's not sex!  I mean -- it can lead to sex... but really, it's just wrestling.

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: I don't wanna talk about it!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: I mean -- uh -- the colors in the sky are so vibrant.  I love this time of day.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But I like you!  Hey!  Why don't we fill the car with gas, drive to Tijuana, and GET MARRIED???

Speaker: mimi
Dialogue: I think I wanna go home.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: No... eh, the Special isn't all like this... just wait... it will be hysterical.

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Christ!  We're the Number One Network -- can't we afford decent TVs?!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: No, um... it's part of the snow.

Speaker: maynard
Dialogue: Tell Kaufman we will NEVER air this program!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, in a sec'.  That was decaf, right?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah, I get that all the time.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Hey!  Could you clear this table and bring me a piece of poundcake?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: NO!  I'd rather work here, than at ABC.  There's no lying in a restaurant.  They don't promise you a job as a cashier, then suddenly make you a frycook!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: The ONLY reason I did Taxi was so I could have my own Special!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Tell you what.  I'll book you on some concerts, and meanwhile, we'll show the Special around... see if somebody wants to buy it --

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah, we can have a garage sale. "Hey look, I got a floor lamp and a network TV Special for only fifty cents!"

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You signed for five years --  So four years, seven months.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay... I'll go back.  But just let them know, first they ain't gettin' Latka.  They're gettin' Tony!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Thank you.  It's great to be here. We're going to have a very nice time.  We'll sing some songs -- SORORITY GIRL DO LATKA!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Uh, we'll play with puppets --

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Excuse me one moment.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Give me the book.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: No!  Andy, don't do it --

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: They're asking for it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Since you're such a special audience... I'm going to reveal, for the first time ever, the real me.  "The Great Gatsby", by F. Scott Fitzgerald!!

Speaker: promoter
Dialogue: Is he ever going to stop?

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Sure.  When he reaches "The End."

Speaker: weak voice
Dialogue: Do Latka.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Nobody likes anarchy more than me... but this is science fiction!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Let's get some breakfast.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: What kind of show was this??!  There were three-hundred walkouts! The promoter wants a refund!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I'm sorry, George...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You're DAMN RIGHT you're sorry!  And you -- you're the road manager! You should be watchin' out for him!

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: We might have lost our focus...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: When you play the Midwest and South, you DON'T MINDFUCK THESE PEOPLE! It's not postmodern -- it's rude.  If you wanna perform in Texas, you give 'em Mighty Mouse!  You give 'em Elvis!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: But George, I like to push the boundaries...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: And that's great.  But do it in LA and New York!  There you experiment! Show up with a sleeping bag and take a nap on stage!  I don't care!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: How long would they let me sleep?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I don't know!  Andy... you need to look inside: Who are you trying to entertain?  The audience... or yourself?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I'm worried about Andy.  His stress level is affecting his work.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Isn't Tony Clifton going on Taxi soon?  Maybe that'll chill him out.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Bob, Andy needs to RELAX.  See if you can get him away from all this. Take him to Hawaii, or Bali... Find something special.  Something nice...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I dunno about this...  What will my mother think?

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: She'll say, "Now my son is a man."

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's so dirty.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Nah.  The girls sponge off between johns.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: This is a big day.  It's my friend's first time with a prostitute.

Speaker: madam
Dialogue: What're you talking about?  Andy comes here almost every weekend.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: You're talking about... Andy?

Speaker: madam
Dialogue: Oh, he doesn't always call himself that.  Sometimes he's Tony, and wears a tux.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: You let me win.

Speaker: hooker
Dialogue: What if we did...?!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hey.  If I give you three-hundred dollars, will you come to LA and help me destroy a TV show?

Speaker: tony danza
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: He just arrived.

Speaker: carol kane
Dialogue: He's an hour late.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Look, I'm told this Clifton guy is a little eccentric.  You're all just gonna have to roll with the punches this week.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Taxi!  Laxy!  Just the factsy, Maxie!  Them's all the words that rhyme with taxi!... Right, girls?

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: And now, the new theme song!  "Oh yes, we drive a taxi, And we're havin' fun. Yeah, we work together, And we get the freakin' job done."

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: George, we've lost two days. Filming is on Friday.  We HAVE to let him go!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I'm not sure how Andy's gonna take this...

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: So we'll go downstairs and tell him!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: But that's Tony down there.  That's not Andy.  Trust me, it's like "Sybil" -- Andy's nowhere on the premises!

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Well whoever the fuck that is, I'm firing him!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Okay.  But we'll have to warn Andy first.  I think he's up in San Francisco, doing a concert.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Hi, Andy.  How's the weather up there?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I'm here with Ed over at Taxi. There's been some trouble with Tony.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: No, no, Andy, nothing like that.  But... Tony's not fitting in.  His style of performance is too... burlesque.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Andy, I'm calling you up like this because I have the utmost respect for your artistry.  But -- I need your permission to fire him.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: There'll be other shots.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Andy, I have to do it.  He's a terrible actor.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Yes, Andy, I will.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: FUCK YOU!  I AIN'T GOIN'!!

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: We had a deal!!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: I don't know what yer talkin' about. You musta talked to someone else --

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Yeah!!  I talked to Andy Kaufman!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: I don't know nothin' about no Kaufman.  He's been ridin' my coattails, smearing my reputation. Been usin' my good name, to get places.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Get off my stage!  You're fired!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: I GOT A CONTRACT!!  I'm gonna take you to the DEPARTMENT OF LABOR!

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Who're YOU?!

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: I'm from the LA Times.  We're doing a little puff piece on Mr. Clifton.  Mr. Kaufman arranged it.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Security!  Escort this man off the lot!!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Stop!  GETCHER HANDS OFF ME!

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: I don't want those pictures getting out.

Speaker: security guard
Dialogue: This is a closed set.  You'll have to give me the film in that camera.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: I'll take care of this.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Wait -- he's one of THEM!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Stop!  HELP!  You wouldn't do this to Wayne Newton --

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Hey.  Good hustlin'.

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: That asshole!  That FUCKING BASTARD!!  We had a fuckin' deal, and THAT COCKSUCKER SHAFTED ME!!

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: Um, Ed... you have a phone call --

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: I'M NOT IN!

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: Well, um... it's Andy Kaufman...

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Yeah???

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: ed
Dialogue: Well -- thank you.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: This is great!  It makes Tony REAL - - three-dimensional!  It's very good for his career.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: "Was this in actuality Andy Kaufman? And if it was Andy Kaufman, is Andy Kaufman crazy?"

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Boy, they totally fell for it!  I'm only acting crazy!

Speaker: booker
Dialogue: Mr. Shapiro, this is Gene Knight, up at Harrah's Tahoe.  We'd like to book Andy Kaufman for our showroom.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Ehh -- Andy doesn't really like playing casinos.  The audiences don't work well for him.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Really?!  You want Tony Clifton to headline Harrah's Tahoe??

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Look -- I gotta be clear with you. Tony Clifton is NOT Andy Kaufman.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: No, I'm serious.  If you book Tony, do NOT EXPECT TO GET ANDY.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Fine, be my guest!  Book him.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Gene, you misunderstood!!  You're not getting BOTH of them!  It's physically impossible!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah, I KNOW what I said!  But -- trust me, it's not gonna happen!

Speaker: pushy man
Dialogue: You're not listenin'!  It's a VERY simple concept.

Speaker: pushy man
Dialogue: Trust me!  You'll never see them on stage at the same time!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: SHUT UP!!!!!!

Speaker: pushy man
Dialogue: He's never gonna start!  Kaufman thinks this is funny!  We've paid forty bucks for a show that's never gonna start!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Thank you!  Thank you!  I wrote this tune for my friend Frank Sinatra. He had a nice little success with it... but forgot to thank me on the album.

Speaker: george

They'll think they're laughin' at me -- but actually I'll be laughin' at them, because they're wrong and I'm right!

Dialogue: You're NOT DYING!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay.  You're probably right.

Speaker: lynne
Dialogue: God, you're so detached!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Dad...?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: The cancer started in Andy's left arm and spread to his lungs.  We've initiated an aggressive radiation program... see if we can eradicate the affected cells.  Excuse me.  I'll be right back.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: What a crock.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: How dare you make light of this!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Dad, I cried when he broke his neck. He's not gettin' me again --

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Jesus!  He's got lung cancer!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: See, that's exactly it!  He picked lung cancer, because he doesn't smoke.  That makes it weird!  If he'd picked leukemia, it'd be totally believable, and we'd all be going, "Poor Andy, he's really sick."  So he chose lung cancer, because he WANTS us to be scratching our heads, saying, "Is this real?"

Speaker: janice
Dialogue: Of course it's real.  We're in a hospital...

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Mom, it's Cedars-Sinai!  It's a showbiz hospital!  Andy's studio friends probably run this place!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: He plans these things out.  He takes over, hires actors...  Personally, I didn't think that "doctor" was very convincing.

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: Did you notice his costume had the wrong shoes?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Yeah!  He didn't have doctor shoes!

Speaker: michael
Dialogue: We all know he's talked about faking his own death...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Sure -- but what if he isn't?  My son could be dying... and we're actin' like we're on Candid Camera.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I see them... I see the white cells...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: What was that all about?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's visualization therapy.  He's helping me turn inward and fight the disease.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: He's an actor.  I remember him in "The In-Laws."

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Uh, yes... that's true.  But he's also ordained in holistic medicine.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You must take a little pleasure in it.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Of course!  But that doesn't mean I don't need everyone's support!  I can't be surrounded by negative energy.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Andy, you're surrounded by what you create.  You are the KING of negative energy.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Y-yeah?  Well, then it has to stop! Because if these bad vibes get out... then everyone will be talkin' about how sick I am, and it becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and then -- I'm dead.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: So how can I help you...?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I wanna go back to work and put on a happy show.  The best show anybody's ever seen!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Do you wanna tour the clubs?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No clubs.  I wanna reach the TOP!  Carnegie Hall...!

Speaker: editor
Dialogue: What bullshit!  No.  No more Kaufman stories!  He's burned us too many times!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: This is great.  The crowd's gonna love this!  Hey... do you still think any of those cowgirls are still alive?

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: I dunno.  If they were, they'd be

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, call SAG.  It'd be cool to get one on the show.  I want the evening to build and build.  It's gonna have the most incredible ending: Singers, dancers, the "Hallelujah Chorus" -- then the sky opens, and Santa Claus comes flying down!

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: And you say, "Santa, what am I gettin' for Christmas?"  And he says, "Cancer!"

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No!  NO NO NO!  None of that!  I want this show to be positive!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: That's great... but this show's gonna cost a fortune.  Even if it sells out, you'll still lose eighty grand.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I don't care about the money.  I just want the show to deliver.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: So who's gonna pay for it?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Tony Clifton.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You know Tony doesn't have that kind of money.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Then he'll borrow it.  I know Tony better than you do.  Even if he has to work another ten years to pay it off, he'll do it!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Okay, Andy.  Will do.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Abbu daba, abi abbu daba!  Abbu daba, abu dabu do!  Abbu dabbu da ba do...!

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: ABBU DABBU DA BA DO!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: A ba du ba ti la ma na go!

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: A BA DU BA TI... LA... MA NA GO...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Abbu da ba du ba ti lama na gobo abi tabu la!

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: ABBU DA BA DU...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemen!  I'm pleased to announce that we have with us the one surviving cowgirl from that 1931 film, Eleanor "Cody" Gould!!

Speaker: eleanor
Dialogue: Andy... this is so overwhelming...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Well, it's gettin' even better! 'Cause we found one of the original hobby horses!  Do you -- do you think you could treat us to a few steps from "Jingle Jangle Jingle"?

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Is there a doctor in the house??!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemen, she's alive!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemen, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir!!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Single file!  Don't rush!  There's enough cookies for everyone!!

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I don't want this to ever end...

Speaker: healer
Dialogue: Now we'll place a blue crystal. Very high vibrations.  It's wonderful for it's healing powers.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Okay.  Let's try two of those... and one of the pink ones.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: Your friend is doing four crystal sessions a day, but it's just not helping.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: I know...  The cancer's terminal.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: Yes.  That wasn't made particularly clear to us when he checked in...

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Look, personally, I think rubbing rocks on people is a load of horseshit.  But if it makes Andy happy, that's all that matters.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: I'm sorry to sound crass -- but we don't want to be "that health resort in New Mexico where Andy Kaufman died."  I'm going to have to ask you to leave.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: It's okay, Bob.  It wasn't really working.  We'll find something better.

Speaker: little wendy
Dialogue: What is this stuff?

Speaker: lynne
Dialogue: It's all macrobiotic.  Millet, burdock root, kelp... Andy says it'll purify him.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: How 'bout me and you dolls go get some REAL food:  French fries and a Porterhouse steak!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: I ain't Andy!  I'm Tony!  Andy's sick -- pick, chick, kick, lick! The doctor says he's a goner.  But Tony's built like a mule!  Andy asked me to be his pallbearer!  I'll do it for him!  I'm getting stronger and stronger!  Here, watch this!

Speaker: lynne
Dialogue: Stop it!  C'mon, put that down.

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Yeah, you're right.  We better get movin'.  We don't wanna miss Happy Hour at Kelbos -- all the Mai Tai's

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Dammit...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I can't move my arm.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: You've got good days and bad days.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: My hair is coming out.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: I've got an idea for a new TV show for me to star in.  It's called "Uncle Andy's Fun House" -- it'll be a Saturday morning thing where I can goof off with the kids.  You know, puppets, magic tricks...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I think we can sell that.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Hey... thanks for always backin' me.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Did your -- doctor say it's okay for you to go back to work?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Ehhh, you know those guys.  If he had his way, I'd be stuck in the hospital, running tests all day.  And anyway, I've found a new guy who's gonna be able to instantly remove the cancer.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: Yeah!  He's a psychic surgeon in the Philippines, and he's amazing!  He rubs you and sucks the disease right out!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: The Philippines?  I dunno... Andy... he sounds like one of your characters.

Speaker: andy
Dialogue: No... this guy's special.  He performs miracles.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: It's a perfect Kaufman audience.

Speaker: zmuda
Dialogue: Yeah.  They don't know whether to be sad, or angry.

Speaker: carol kane
Dialogue: Why are people leaving?  The curtain's gonna open.  Andy's gonna come out... I know it!

Speaker: tony danza
Dialogue: Sure, the body was just made of wax...!  Wasn't it......?

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: How ya doin'?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Andy!

Speaker: tony clifton
Dialogue: Don't know nothin' about no Andy. Just some dead guy tryin' to ride my coattails.  Let's HIT IT, boys!  One, two, anda one two three four!
